definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Saladin joined in from the rear.
The Sultan Saladin and his bodyguard.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉丁和麾下精锐卫队。

sentences.english: The ascension to the vizierate was clearly a defining moment in his life.
sentences.chinese: 升为维齐尔显然是萨拉丁一生中的关键时刻。

sentences.english: Salatin says he would need another full-time staffer.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉丁说要是想申请，可能得再顾一名全职员工才行。

sentences.english: 1187 - Saladin begins the Siege of Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 1187年的今天，萨拉丁开始“耶路撒冷之围”。

sentences.english: Saladin, at age 26, went along with them.
sentences.chinese: 时年26岁的萨拉丁也随同前往。

sentences.english: The Fatimid State in Egypt was on the verge of total disintegration in the period before Saladin's arrival.
sentences.chinese: 埃及的法蒂玛王朝在萨拉丁到来前濒于完全崩溃。

sentences.english: Saladin emblem for the Eagle emblem, the symbol of Mesopotamia civilization.
sentences.chinese: 国徽为萨拉丁雄鹰徽，象征两河流域的文明。

sentences.english: This information was crucial to freeing Saradin with the Bell of Light.
sentences.chinese: 这是解救萨拉丁事件中最为关键的情报。

definition: (loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Richard the Lionheart (1157-1199), King Richard I of England 1189-1199
Pompeium, Roman town in Bay of Naples destroyed by eruption of Vesuvius in 79/Pompey (Roman general)
Cyrus the Great (ca. 600-530 BC), the founder of the Persian Empire and the conqueror of Babylon
